_header: When Mary was greet with Gabriel

BLAdd15225.First Lines:
When marie was great with GabriellAnd had conceiuid and borne a
                    child…
BLAdd15225.Last Lines:
…Christ keepe vs out of harme & batefor thy holie spirit
                    soe speciall
BLAdd15225.Editions:
Rollins,  Hyder E. 
             Old English ballads, 1553-1625, Chiefly from Manuscripts.
         Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1920: 384-404.

BLAdd37492.First Lines:
Whan marye was grete with GabryelHadde conseyued and born a
                    chylde…
BLAdd37492.Last Lines:
…God take oure soules to hys rentIn heuene blys from helle
                    preson
BLAdd37492.Attributed Title:
Here ys wryten the ffendys parlement / How Ihesu wyȝth hys passyon hem
                    blent (explicit, f. 90v)

Lam853.First Lines:
Whanne marye was greet with gabrielAnd had conceyued & boren a
                    childeAlle þe deuelis of þe eir of erþe & of
                    helleHelden þer paralement of þat maide mylde…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…He helpe us in alle at heuene ȝateWiþ seintis to
                    sitte þere in saleCrist kepe us out of harme and hateffor
                    þin hooli spirit so special
Lam853.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Hymns to the Virgin and Christ…and other religious poems.
EETS
         o.s. 24 (1867); repr. 1973: 41-57.
